jQuery

Quick reference

jQuery targetting

object command
Type $("button")
Class $(".btn")
Id $("#target4")

jQuery Methods
.addClass()
Adds a class to the element.		 .remove()
Removes an element.		 .appendTo()
Moves an element elsewhere.		 :nth-child(#)
Selects a specific child.		 :odd/:even
Targets all odd or even elements.
.removeClass()
Removes a class from an element		 .clone()
Duplicates an element.		 .css()
Alters the CSS of an element.		 .prop()
Alters the HTML properties of an element.		 .html()
Adds HTML (incl. tags) to an element
.text()
Adds text to an element (no formatting).		 .parent()
Targets an element's parent.		 .children()
Targets all children of an element.		 $("body")
Selects the whole HTML body element.

Script Tag & Document ready

<script>$(document).ready(function() { ... });</script>

→ Avoids code from being ran before the page is finished loading.

jQuery Selectors

All jQuery selectors start with $.

→ Example: $("button").addClass("animatedBounce");

Targeting HTML elements

Target element by class

$(".well").addClass("animated");

//Selects elements with class *well* and adds additional classes to the element.

Target element by id

$("#target4").addClass("fadeOut");
//Selects elements by id with #, much like in CSS.

Targetting the same element with multiple selectors

Using inheritable objects, selecting multiple elements is also inherited:

$("button.btn#target-btn").text("click here");

Remove classes from an element →.remove() 

$("button").removeClass("animated");
//Removes "animated" from the "button" objects.

Change the CSS of an element →.css()

$("#target").css("color", "blue");
//Pay attention to the different notation from normal css => (#property: #value)

Disable elements with jQuery →.prop()

$("button").prop("disabled", true);
//.prop() alters the HTML element properties.

Change text inside an element →.html()/.text()

$("h3").html("<em>jQuery</em>");
//Adds text and tags!

$("p").text("Hello world!");
//Adds only text to the element.

Move elements →.appendTo()

$("#target2").appendTo("#right-well");
//Moves element#target2 to #right-well.

Clone elements →.clone()

$("#target5").clone().appendTo("#left");
//Remember to combine .clone() with .appendTo()!

Targetting an element's parents →.parent() 

$("#target3").parent().css("color", "green");
//Selects the parent element of #target3.

Targetting children of an element →:nth-child(n)

$(".target:nth-child(3)").addClass("animated");
//Within the $selector, using :nth-childr(n), n being the selected child.

Target even or odd elements →:even/:odd

$(".target:odd").addClass("animated bounce");
//Adds a new class to all odd items with class of target.

Modify the entire page →$("body")

$("body")
//Selects the entire HTML body element.
